availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Mary Perkins. Father of Catharine Perkins, James Perkins, Palina Perkins, Abram Perkins, Lewis Perkins, Jacob Perkins, John Perkins, Nancy Perkins, and Mary S. Perkins. Miller in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 138. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 45. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Munfordville, p. 28.
